message: To all of my Constituents in the 18th Congressional District, please make sure to exercise extra precaution during this weekend’s expected heavy storms and flooding. For those in need of resources, review the helpful list on my website. Make sure to register in advance to receive local emergency alerts via e-mail and text.   Para los residentes del Distrito 18, por favor asegúrense de tomar precaución adicional durante las fuertes tormentas e inundaciones previstas este fin de semana. Para los que necesiten recursos, revisen la lista de ayuda en mi página y regístrense para recibir alertas de emergencia local por correo electrónico y texto.  http://eshoo.house.gov/constituent-services/storm-preparedness-resources/

Many constituents have contacted me about the President-Elect’s conflicts of interest with his business ties and how this relates to the Emoluments Clause in the U.S. Constitution.  The following video explains it well.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qtVz62r8sSY
Don’t miss your chance to buy health insurance for 2017! CoveredCA Open Enrollment ends January 31. Find out if you qualify for financial help: http://bit.ly/2dCoQWR

Today is Religious Freedom Day, a time to remember those who lost their lives simply for practicing their religion.  As the daughter of Christians who fled persecution in the Middle East, the importance of religious freedom is interwoven in the history of my family as it is in the history of the United States. The freedom of religion embodied in the First Amendment is one of the most important and foundational rights in our country and it is what makes our nation a shining beacon of freedom and tolerance for the entire world. Freedom of religion is in the interest of our national security and a high value of our democracy.   As President Obama has said before, "an attack on any faith is an attack on every faith." We must continue our important work to promote freedom and tolerance. Religious freedom is a value of and a critical underpinning of our democracy.  https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2017/01/13/presidential-proclamation-religious-freedom-day-2017

I’m a thousand percent opposed to Mr. Pruitt’s nomination to run the EPA and I’m urging my colleagues in the Senate to vote against him given his extensive record in opposition to science based sound environmental policy.   http://www.epw.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2017/1/hearing-on-nomination-of-attorney-general-scott-pruitt-to-be-administrator-of-the-u-s-environmental-protection-agency
To all of my constituents who will be attending the inauguration, my office will be open in 241 Cannon Building tomorrow and we welcome you to come by for hot chocolate and croissants.
I'm attending the inauguration not to celebrate who is taking the oath, but to live up to mine. And by doing so, I hope to set a good example for all I'm privileged to represent.
My office will also be open on Saturday for my constituents participating in events throughout the weekend. Stop by to leave a comment and make your voices heard.

Repealing the Affordable Care Act means 32 million Americans would be left uninsured, causing premiums to skyrocket over the next decade.  Read the full report here- https://www.cbo.gov/publication/52371

The new FCC chairman has threatened to roll back the important progress we’ve made for consumers over the last eight years. The American people spoke powerfully for a free and open internet, and I will fight any efforts to undo this progress by the FCC’s new leadership.  http://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-pai-fcc-chairman-20170123-story.html

Two days after millions of women marched to oppose the new president's backward policies, he reinstated the Global Gag Rule, a federal ban that will directly affect a woman's access adequate healthcare in the U.S. and abroad. It's up to Congress to permanently repeal this dangerous rule and I've cosponsored the Global HER Act to end this outdated policy once and for all.  https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/23/world/trump-ban-foreign-aid-abortions.html

Today, I offered legislation on the floor of the House requiring sitting presidents and presidential nominees of major parties to publicly disclose their three prior years of federal tax returns.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RRhvcJXbhjo

In his encyclical, Laudato Si, Pope Francis wrote ‘the earth herself, burdened and laid waste, is among the most abandoned and maltreated of our poor.’ Reports of President Trump’s efforts to silence climate change experts by demanding a review on their research and data before they release it is symbolic of the new Administration abandoning the earth and ignoring scientific facts.  Global climate change is real and it's one of the most critical issues facing our nation and the planet. Climate change and its dangerous effects cannot be kept on the back burner and dealt with decades from now. Across the American landscape, including my Congressional District, people are experiencing the hottest years on record and enduring severe floods, wildfires and droughts. We cannot afford to undo the progress we’ve made on reversing the effects of climate change.  http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/25/politics/trump-epa-lockdowns/

Time and time again President Trump has mocked, ridiculed, and threatened anyone who is different from him in our country. Today, he took steps to temporarily shut our doors to those seeking refuge in the United States. Our refugee resettlement program already contains the most stringent screening in the world including thirteen steps of tough vetting. The refugees that the President has shut our doors to today are not terrorists, they are the victims of terrorism who have occupied their homelands.   As a child of immigrants, I will continue to stand up for refugees and vigorously oppose the Administration’s shameful efforts to rob hope from the hopeless.
The President's Executive Order on refugees is appalling and shameful. It is un-American and unconstitutional, I will fight it with all my might. #LetThemIn

I want all my constituents to know that my office and staff stand ready to help anyone who contacts us in the 18th Congressional District that is affected by the President's appalling Executive Order.   I will also fight with all my strength to reverse this unconstitutional ban.   You can call 650-323-2984. We're here to assist in every way possible.

Tonight I stand on the steps of the Supreme Court of our nation to condemn the President's appalling, un-American, unconstitutional Executive Order.   The Statue of Liberty Values (SOLVE Act) is legislation I support because it will reverse the President's Order and ensure that America remains the safe haven it has always been for refugees.   As a first generation American I will give everything I have in this fight to reverse this nightmare being inflicted on innocent people.
I'm a veteran of the House Intelligence Committee, but it doesn't take a veteran of the House Intelligence Committee to understand that Trump's immigration ban harms our national security.

The appointment of Steve Bannon to the National Security Council is outrageous. As an eight year veteran of the House Intelligence Committee, I know full well that to leave out our nation’s top military official, the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, and the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) who oversees the entire intelligence community, substantially weakens our national security. I’m aghast that the new President would place a person without any experience on this critical panel and leave out two of the most critical.

I do not support the nomination of Judge Neil Gorsuch and here is why:  His judicial record is one which is antithetical to the values of my constituents: the protection of healthcare for women; consumer rights; the protection of our environment.  Judge Gorsuch’s decisions have gone directly against the rights of women both in their careers and in their personal lives. In the Hobby Lobby case, he joined the majority in stripping reproductive rights from women in the workplace. By continuously supporting defunding Planned Parenthood, millions of women are left without essential healthcare services to detect breast cancer, cervical cancer and other special medical screenings vital to women.  Judge Gorsuch has consistently voted against consumers, including in Strickland vs. UPS, where he dissented to a ruling giving a female UPS driver a chance to prove sex discrimination. Just last year, Judge Gorsuch ruled against a consumer who was wrongly charged hundreds of dollars in Elizabeth Hammond vs. Stamps.com, making it easier for companies to move their case to federal court, a move that favors big businesses and harms consumers.  He has embraced a radical legal doctrine that would allow the courts to overrule agency experts implementing regulations to protect the American people. These laws would allow judges to overrule essential protections for Americans put in place by agencies involving the environment, essential workers’ rights and safeguards for consumers.  If approved by the Senate, Judge Gorsuch’s decisions will affect the American people for decades to come. His record is far outside the judicial mainstream and the American people deserve better than a far right wing, activist judge that has a record of choosing the most powerful interests over those of extraordinary, ordinary Americans.

The contributions of African Americans to American history and culture are worthy of commemorating during Black History Month. It's a time to celebrate progress and recommit ourselves to the challenges that lie ahead.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g18APxPCd58

As the daughter of immigrants and unswerving supporter of civil liberties, I want to ensure that my constituents are aware of their rights and resources should they be detained by law enforcement authorities. If you or someone you know is being held or questioned unjustly, you can visit my website for a list of legal services that can provide assistance.    All individuals, regardless of their legal status have constitutional rights. I will continue to advocate and fight on behalf of my constituents to ensure their rights are not violated. You can always call my Palo Alto office at (650) 323-2984 if you need immediate attention. We’re here to assist you in every way possible. -- Como la hija de inmigrantes y alguien que apoya los derechos de inmigrantes, quiero asegurarme que los residentes del distrito 18 tengan información sobre sus derechos si son detenidos por autoridades de inmigración. Si alguien que usted conoce es detenido injustamente, visite mi página para una lista e información de servicios legales que lo podrán ayudar. Es importarte conocer sus derechos en estos momentos difíciles.    Toda la gente viviendo en este país, sin importar su estatus legal, tiene derechos constitucionales ante las autoridades de inmigración y continuare luchando por los residentes de mi distrito. Recuerde, siempre puede contactar a mi oficina en Palo Alto al número (650) 323-2984 si necesita asistencia inmediatamente. Estamos aquí para asistir.   http://eshoo.house.gov/constituent-services/legal-services/

The February 3rd decision by the FCC Chairman, Ajit Pai to strip away the ability of nine broadband companies to participate in the Lifeline Program demonstrates a blatant disregard for millions of vulnerable citizens. This program is essential in the effort to close the digital divide. It helps children do their homework and parents find a job. In July of 2016, Commissioner Pai testified at the Communications and Technology Subcommittee that there was waste, fraud, and abuse in the Lifeline Program, yet under questioning, he admitted he had yet to find any evidence to support his claims.  It was the FCC that stopped private sector bad actors that were fraudulently ripping off the public sector in the Lifeline Program and they were fined accordingly.   This decision should be reversed.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-switch/wp/2017/02/03/the-fcc-is-stopping-9-companies-from-providing-subsidized-broadband-to-the-poor/?utm_term=.47f80fb0a3b7
It is a danger to our democracy when one party attempts to silence the other for simply reading a letter into the record of the Senate. #LetLizSpeak http://wapo.st/2lnUAhu

I’m hearing from hundreds of my constituents today about H.R. 861, a bill to eliminate the EPA, so I’d like to state unequivocally that I’m vehemently opposed to this irresponsible legislation which would threaten clean air and water for all Americans. The EPA was created by President Nixon in 1970 and has protected our environment under presidents of both parties. It is hard to believe that in the 21st century we’re battling anti-science proposals.

The unanimous decision ruling against reinstating the travel ban by the Ninth Circuit Court proves we have important checks and balances in our system of government. I'm heartened by their decision.  https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/09/us/politics/appeals-court-trump-travel-ban.html
An open letter to my constituents: http://eshoo.house.gov/news-stories/e-newsletters/an-open-letter-to-my-constituents-on-president-trump/

Today, I took another step in holding the Trump Administration accountable by cosponsoring H.Res. 111. This resolution would require the Department of Justice to brief Congress on any and all information on the President’s conflicts of interest and his ties to Russia. Congress must continue to push for answers on his web of business ties and potential ethical violations.

The American people deserve to know everything on how tight Putin’s grip is on a U.S. President, and that our democracy cannot be hacked, toyed with, diminished or manipulated.  http://eshoo.house.gov/news-stories/press-releases/eshoo-statement-on-resignation-of-national-security-adviser-michael-flynn/

On Saturday, March 4th I’ll be hosting an in-person Town Hall Meeting in Campbell to answer my constituents’ questions and hear their concerns. For more details, you can visit my website here- http://eshoo.house.gov/about-anna/events/. I hope to see you there!

Yesterday, I joined with 167 of my colleagues in filing an amicus brief in the ACLU lawsuit challenging President Trump’s immigration and travel ban. Our brief was filed in Darweesh vs. Trump, a lawsuit brought in the Eastern District of New York by an Iraqi who risked his life to assist our military but was detained at JFK airport despite having a valid visa to enter the United States.  It is no secret that President Trump’s immigration ban harms our national security. Our brief argues what we already know: that the President’s immigration order is in violation of our Constitution and our immigration laws because it determines who can enter the country based on religion and nationality. I will continue to give everything I have in this fight to reverse this nightmare being inflicted on so many.

Scott Pruitt is not worthy to lead the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). His years of suing the EPA and working to strip protections the American people depend on, speaks for itself.   His confirmation to head up the Agency forebodes damaging policies he has sought and the American people will be the losers.   Clean air and clean water are necessities in life, and I'll keep fighting for science-based policies.   https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/energy-environment/wp/2017/02/17/scott-pruitt-long-time-adversary-of-epa-confirmed-to-lead-the-agency/?utm_term=.9706ee6fadec

I never imagined that the electrification of a train would be subjected to such brutal, partisan politics.  http://eshoo.house.gov/news-stories/press-releases/eshoo-statement-on-us-dots-decision-to-delay-caltrain-funding/

I’m very proud to cosponsor Rep. Jerry Nadler’s Resolution of Inquiry which calls for greater transparency from the Trump Administration. The American people deserve to know everything regarding the relationship between Vladimir Putin and the President. This resolution would help to produce facts and lead to truth.

The Attorney General Jeff Sessions, the top law enforcement official in our nation lied under oath about meeting with the Russians, and for this he should resign immediately. Lying under oath when testifying before the Senate during his nomination hearing makes him unfit to serve.  The questions continue to mount about Russia’s role in our national elections, who met with whom, if there was any collusion on the part of the Trump campaign with the Russians, and why the President consistently defends Vladimir Putin. This is why a bipartisan independent commission should be established to get the facts and pursue the truth. The American people deserve to know who did what and the extent of the damage to our democracy.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/sessions-spoke-twice-with-russian-ambassador-during-trumps-presidential-campaign-justice-officials-say/2017/03/01/77205eda-feac-11e6-99b4-9e613afeb09f_story.html?hpid=hp_hp-top-table-main_sessions-920pm%3Ahomepage%2Fstory&utm_term=.45c42217983d

Thank you to every constituent who attended my town hall meeting today, and for the thoughtful, excellent questions. It's an honor to represent you.

March is Women's History Month and a time to recognize the extraordinary contributions of women in our country. The success of our nation depends on the advancement and security of women and their families.   That's why I will continue to fight for an economic agenda and opportunities that lift up women and their families. Our mothers, wives, sisters and daughters deserve the same opportunities as our fathers, husbands, brothers and sons.

The Administration’s ill-conceived travel ban has reminded Americans that we have an obligation to uphold the Constitution and the values that make this country so great.  http://eshoo.house.gov/news-stories/press-releases/eshoo-statement-on-trumps-new-travel-ban-executive-order/

There really isn't anything we deal with here in Congress that is more personal than health care. These words are going to walk right into the lives of the people we represent.

I stand with the Jewish community in Los Gatos and throughout our entire Congressional District and condemn the cowardly acts of hatred and intimidation directed at them. I condemn the Antisemitism and call for a vigorous investigation to bring the guilty forward to face justice.  http://www.mercurynews.com/2017/03/09/los-gatos-jewish-community-center-evacuated-for-bomb-threat/
This bill doesn't deserve one vote in Congress.  http://eshoo.house.gov/news-stories/press-releases/eshoo-statement-following-cbo-evaluation-of-gop-bill-to-replace-aca/

It was an honor to be with advocates and former Vice President Joe Biden to commemorate the seventh anniversary of the Affordable Care Act.   Seven years, 20+ million insured, millions more empowered to take ownership of their health care. We cannot turn back the clock and make America sick again.
Every human being has a spark of divinity in them, and we dishonor that with this legislation. It is not worthy of the American people.

I'll be on the House Floor today fighting against the Republican's plan to take health insurance away from millions of Americans. Tune in- https://www.c-span.org/video/?425937-1/house-begins-debate-health-care-bill-vote-expected-afternoon&live

The American people are very smart. They listen up. What our colleagues on the other side of the aisle have brought forward today is a disaster for the American people, and the American people know it.

Today is a great victory for the American people. They made their voices heard that they rejected having 24 million people thrown off their health insurance policies. I also believe they want continuing improvements to the Affordable Care Act.

I’m voting against S.J. Res. 34, because I believe the American people have the right to have their private information protected. #BroadbandPrivacy   http://www.theverge.com/2017/3/27/15073162/fcc-broadband-internet-privacy-rules-congress-vote
Congress is poised today to betray the American people on one of the issues they care most deeply about – their privacy.
Joint Town Hall with Congressman Panetta
It was an honor to join Rep. Panetta and my constituents in Capitola today for a thoughtful discussion on issues they care most about. Thank you for spending your Saturday with us!

Today is #EqualPayDay, the symbolic day when more than three months into the year, women’s wages catch up to what men were paid in the previous year. With a record number of women in the workforce, wage discrimination hurts the majority of American families, both in terms of their economic security today and their retirement security tomorrow. Pay inequity due to gender discrimination is real, it should not be tolerated, and we need to take action against it.
NA

Today, I stood with House Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi and House Democrats to launch a Discharge Petition and #DemandAVote on my legislation, the Presidential Tax Transparency Act, requiring President Trump and all future presidents to release their tax returns.

The horrors the Syrian people have been subjected to by Bashar al-Assad are beyond any boundaries of human behavior.   Last night's airstrikes appear to be proportional to the use of chemical weapons. However, should the President intend to escalate U.S. military involvement in Syria, he must come to Congress for an Authorization for Use of Military Force.

This Saturday, April 22nd I’ll be hosting an in-person Town Hall Meeting in Redwood City at Cañada College to answer my constituents’ questions and hear their concerns. Doors will open at 9:00 a.m. and seating is first come, first served. For more details, you can visit my website here- http://eshoo.house.gov/about-anna/events/. I hope to see you there!

We're reminded today, on Tax Day, that there’s no excuse for the president to be able to hide his financial dealings from the American people. My legislation, the Presidential Tax Transparency Act, requires the president and all future presidential nominees of major political parties to release their tax returns. The American people deserve the truth.  http://www.latimes.com/opinion/editorials/la-ed-trump-taxes-20170418-story.html

**CORRECTED:  On this day 102 years ago the world bore witness to the systematic and deliberate annihilation of 1.5 million Armenians, Assyrians, Greeks and other minorities by the Ottoman Empire.   Despite efforts beginning in 1975 to formally recognize the Armenian Genocide, Congress has yet to acknowledge what took place 102 years ago. I’m proud to have consistently cosponsored the Armenian Genocide Resolution in every Congress I’ve served in to have formal recognition by the government of the United States, and I will not rest until we are successful.    Let us take the time today to remember the 1.5 million people who were taken from us—parents, grandparents, brothers, sisters, aunts, uncles and cousins. Each succeeding generation will hold them in their hearts and we will never forget. May we honor them by rising to the occasion and formally recognizing their loss and collectively say, “Never again.”
NA

For more information on our internship opportunities, you can visit my website: http://eshoo.house.gov/constituent-services/student-internships/

The firing of FBI Director James Comey, who was investigating the President and his ties to Russia, is deeply troubling. It is even more troubling that Attorney General Jeff Sessions, who said he would recuse himself from this investigation, played a direct role in Director Comey’s termination.  The President fired Sally Yates, then he fired Preet Bharara, and now he has fired Director Comey, all people who were investigating the President. This is not a coincidence.  I called for a bipartisan, independent commission to investigate the President and his ties to Russia long before his Administration began. The pattern of this Administration thus far shows that only an independent commission or special prosecutor, free from the grasp of the President, will be able to fully and credibly continue this investigation.  https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/09/us/politics/james-comey-fired-fbi.html?hp&action=click&pgtype=Homepage&clickSource=story-heading&module=span-ab-top-region&region=top-news&WT.nav=top-news&_r=0

I want to acknowledge the unintentional mistake I made in my statement of April 24, 2017, on the 102nd commemoration of the Armenian Genocide by not specifically including Assyrians and Greeks, who suffered great losses at the hands of the Ottoman Empire.

The reports that the President shared highly classified information with Russian diplomats are deeply troubling for several reasons. As a veteran of the House Intelligence Committee, I know full well the jeopardy this places our intelligence officers in; the damage this inflicts on an allied country who entrusted the U.S. with the intelligence; and how handing over the most sensitive information to the least trustworthy country – Russia – threatens our national security and our military who serve to protect us.  The President makes the case almost daily as to why an independent, bipartisan commission is essential to investigate what ties exist between the President and Russia.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/trump-revealed-highly-classified-information-to-russian-foreign-minister-and-ambassador/2017/05/15/530c172a-3960-11e7-9e48-c4f199710b69_story.html?hpid=hp_hp-banner-main_trumpintel-0504pm%3Ahomepage%2Fstory&utm_term=.fc6dc70e97d8

Today, FCC Chairman Ajit Pai began the wrecking process to overturn net neutrality, demonstrating that he is on the wrong side of history, consumers and the public interest.   http://eshoo.house.gov/issues/telecommunications/eshoo-statement-on-fcc-net-neutrality-vote/

The appointment of former FBI Director Robert Mueller as Special Prosecutor sends a strong signal of confidence to the American people as the investigation of possible ties between President Trump’s campaign and the Russian government moves forward. I had the privilege of working with Director Mueller as a member of the House Intelligence Committee, and his integrity and experience make him a superb choice to lead this investigation.  https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/17/us/politics/robert-mueller-special-counsel-russia-investigation.html
The events of the last week have made it abundantly clear that we must have disclosure of the President’s tax returns in order to fully understand his connections to Russia.

The announcement by the Secretary of Transportation today to fully fund the electrification of Caltrain is a clear victory for my constituents and the people of the Bay Area.  http://eshoo.house.gov/issues/economy/eshoo-on-caltrain-funding-decision-this-is-an-alleluia-moment/

The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office (CBO) has once again put out the facts on Trumpcare, and they further confirm how damaging the legislation is.  After the dead-of-night changes by Republicans, the legislation provides less coverage for higher costs, with 23 million Americans projected to lose their health insurance. Essential health benefits will be eviscerated for millions of Americans, creating huge cost increases for basic coverage such as maternity care, addiction and mental health treatment, and emergency services. The bill also strips away Medicaid from millions of low-income families and children, and imposes a crushing age tax on older Americans.  Republican and Democratic Senators alike have said Trumpcare is dead on arrival in the upper chamber. We can only hope it stays that way.  http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/25/529909663/patient-doctor-groups-say-new-cbo-score-reveals-health-bills-flaws
ICMY: I shared my thoughts on the President's FY2018 Budget:  https://medium.com/@repannageshoo/the-budget-a-statement-of-our-national-values-b3fe3c5a2544

June is LGBT Pride Month, a time to celebrate the progress the LGBT community has made in the fight for equality in our country, and also a time to recommit ourselves to ensuring that all Americans are treated with equity, dignity and respect.  https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation-now/2017/06/02/why-lgbt-pride-month-june/363261001/

ICYMI: Last week, I joined my House colleagues in calling for the suspension of Jared Kushner's security clearance.   Every day we receive more troubling reports about this Administration’s complete disregard for our national security. Reports that Jared Kushner met with Russian Ambassador Sergey Kislyak, and Vnesheconombank, and did not report in U.S. disclosure forms that he had participated in these meetings raises national security concerns. He also reportedly asked the Russians to set up secret channels for future meetings. These are material omissions that potentially amount to a criminal offense.  http://eshoo.house.gov/news-stories/press-releases/eshoo-calls-for-suspension-of-jared-kushners-security-clearance/

Happening Now: We are at Mozilla to discuss the serious consequences of eviscerating #netneutrality. Tune in- mzl.la/2sN4fFB

‪Today, I had the opportunity to meet with CEOs of several technology companies in Silicon Valley, a librarian, and the Counselor to former FCC Chairman Tom Wheeler, Gigi Sohn, to discuss how the current net neutrality protections affect businesses and our national economy.   As FCC Chairman Ajit Pai continues the process to overturn these critical protections, it's important that we hear directly from these small businesses. We need to know what the negative impacts will be of eliminating these protections on innovation, on startups and on our society.‬

Last year, the international community recorded 65.6 million displaced people, refugees and asylum seekers fleeing violence and persecution in every region of the world—the highest number since World War II. On World Refugee Day, we recognize their incredible fortitude and we send a message that the U.S. - a country whose story has been written by those fleeing oppression and hardship – must do more to help the world’s most vulnerable populations.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2017/06/20/on-world-refugee-day-5-correspondents-reveal-what-its-like-to-cover-the-crisis/?utm_term=.628761db7add

As one of the original creators of ARPA-E, I’m pleased and relieved that the Department of Energy has made the right decision to unfreeze previous-year funding for this agency which funds breakthrough energy research. ARPA-E programs are vital to our nation’s leadership in energy innovation and maximizing our country’s continuing efforts to develop clean energy technologies. These funds should never have been frozen in the first place, and I’ll work hard to preserve future funding for this agency which the President has proposed to eliminate.  https://arstechnica.com/science/2017/06/government-studies-say-arpa-e-epa-funding-programs-dont-need-reform/

Today was the first time in his 7-month tenure that FCC Chairman Pai has testified at a hearing with the Energy and Commerce Committee. I questioned him about his efforts to dismantle net neutrality and urged him to keep the protections in place. I also raised the issue of RT’s (formerly Russia Today) influence in the 2016 election and asked what the FCC is doing to ensure the American public knows who is behind the programming on our public airwaves.

When the President spoke to the American people this week, he had the opportunity to articulate a clear path forward in Afghanistan to a war weary public. Instead, he merely outlined the basic goals past presidents have supported -- stability and security to the region and ensuring the country will not be a safe-haven for terrorists. The war in Afghanistan is the longest engagement in U.S. history, with more than 2,400 American lives lost and billions of taxpayer dollars spent. The President further doubled down on this open-ended conflict by refusing to say how many additional troops he plans to put in harm’s way or giving a timeline for withdrawal.  By failing to even mention the word ‘Congress’ in his speech, the President believes he can move forward with a blank check for Afghanistan without Congress passing a new Authorization for the Use of Military Force (AUMF). We owe it to the thousands of servicemembers still fighting in Afghanistan to have this debate sixteen years after Congress first authorized military operations in Afghanistan after the September 11th attacks.  http://www.sfchronicle.com/opinion/editorials/article/Editorial-President-Trump-needs-a-vision-for-11951150.php

When President Obama established DACA in 2012, the program created a ray of hope for those who were brought to the United States as young children and they are Americans in every way except on paper. President Trump's decision today to terminate this program diminishes that hope for the bright young DREAMers who now call America home.  Over 787,000 individuals have received relief from deportation under the DACA program, allowing them to obtain work permits, pursue higher education, obtain driver’s licenses, and contribute their talents to our nation. These children put their faith in our government when they chose to come out of the shadows and I will fight with all that I have to ensure Congress passes legislation to overrule the President's irresponsible action and ensure that these children can remain in the only country they have ever known.  http://www.mercurynews.com/2017/09/05/trump-expected-to-rescind-daca-program-today-dreamers-vow-to-fight/

Their words are simple and profound. They are the children that know only one home —America.

For more information about renewing your DACA benefits and eligibility, visit www.uscis.gov/daca2017 (en español: www.uscis.gov/es/daca2017) and click on “DACA renewal requests.” You can also call my Palo Alto office at (650) 323-2984 if you need immediate attention. We’re here to assist you in every way possible.

Since President Trump’s first day in office, his administration and Republicans in Congress have relentlessly attacked the reproductive rights and access to health care for women. Today’s announcement from the Administration eliminating birth control coverage in the Affordable Care Act is no different. 62 million women have benefited from the birth control coverage and because of this expanded access, the rate of unintended pregnancies and abortion is at a 40-year low.    Shame on the President for this dangerous rule that sets our country backward and limits a woman's right to health care.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/health-science/trump-administration-could-narrow-affordable-care-acts-contraception-mandate/2017/10/05/16139400-a9f0-11e7-92d1-58c702d2d975_story.html?tid=sm_tw&utm_term=.07b0dec5ed1f

The Trump Administration’s decision to begin the formal repeal of the Clean Power Plan is a monumental attack on the health of the American people. It will increase the output of carbon pollution in the air and do nothing to help the coal miners the President vowed to defend. The Clean Power Plan is a job creation plan, an economic policy and a climate policy. It represents a critical step to protecting our planet for our children and grandchildren, and without it, the U.S. cannot reach the goals established by the Paris Accords.  Even without the plan fully in effect, states like my home state of California are already moving ahead of the targets established by the Clean Power Plan, but federal help is crucial. These are not tangled senseless regulations. They are safety measures to protect the health of our people, our country and the planet.   https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/10/opinion/trump-coal-climate-emissions.html?rref=collection%2Fsectioncollection%2Fopinion&action=click&contentCollection=opinion&region=rank&module=package&version=highlights&contentPlacement=2&pgtype=sectionfront

After six days of silence, FCC Chairman Pai finally addressed the reckless comments from the President on October 11th, suggesting the broadcast license of the National Broadcasting Company (NBC) ‘must be challenged, and if necessary, revoked.’   I urged Chairman Pai in a letter yesterday to publicly reject these indefensible comments that directly violate the basic freedoms of speech and press that are enshrined in the First Amendment. This is not the first attack the President has made on the free press and it certainly will not be the last. The Chairman must uphold his oath of office to our Constitution and First Amendment by publicly rejecting these attacks. Silence is not an option when it comes to their oath or mine.  http://www.politico.com/story/2017/10/17/trump-nbc-license-fcc-ajit-pai-response-243865
NA

It was an honor to attend the ceremony to officially designate the 129th Rescue Wing’s Facility as Moffett Air National Guard Base. My legislation was signed into law to officially designate this airfield in 2016.     The name of this base recognizes the home of the women and men of the 129th Rescue Wing who make countless sacrifices every day to save lives and keep our nation safe. This naming honors the fact that they have long been a part of our community and critical to the people of the Bay Area, our region, our state and our country.

At the Communications and Technology Subcommittee this week I asked Chairman Pai why it took him six days to respond to the President’s reckless comments suggesting the broadcast license of NBC be challenged and revoked, a direct attack on the First Amendment to our Constitution. I wrote to Chairman Pai last week on this issue, demanding he speak out against these attacks and to live up to the oath we take to protect and defend the Constitution.
Open Enrollment for health insurance begins TOMORROW! Check out Covered California which offers great plans and financial help. https://www.coveredca.com/.

Are you a Covered California member? If so, it’s time to renew your health insurance coverage for 2018. Free in-person help is available in our Congressional District.   To sign up, call Covered California’s Service Center at (800) 300-1506. You can also apply online at www.CoveredCA.com, or have a certified enroller contact you through the ‘Help on Demand’ feature.

Today, I joined over 200 of my colleagues in an Amicus Brief supporting a same-sex couple in the U.S. Supreme Court Case Masterpiece Cakeshop v. Colorado Civil Rights Commission. In this case the owner of a bakery refused to sell a wedding cake to a same-sex couple. The Supreme Court will consider whether or not businesses can ignore state nondiscrimination laws if their motivation for discriminating is based on religious or moral disapproval of LGBT individuals.  The case has the potential to create a broad loophole to every nondiscrimination statute across the country.  The fight for LGBT equality did not end with marriage equality. We have to continue the battle to ensure LGBT Americans do not face discrimination and are treated with equity, dignity and respect.

This morning I joined several California Democratic colleagues to discuss the devastating impacts the Ryan-McConnell Tax Plan will have on my constituents and all Californians. I called out the 14 Republican members of the California delegation for betraying their constituents and our state by voting to eliminate the deductibility of state and local taxes.  I particularly referenced Rep. Ed Royce’s District, where almost 212,000 of his constituents benefit from the State and Local Tax Deduction (SALT), saving over $15,000 every year. If the Ryan-McConnell plan is signed into law, Rep. Royce’s constituents and their local economies will be dealt a heavy blow from the elimination of this deduction which is aimed directly at the middle class.
Yesterday, Republicans unveiled their vision for tax reform, and it isn't pretty.
